intro: Camissonia claviformis var. lancifolia, commonly known as the slender-leafed camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The species is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. This plant is adapted to dry environments and is often found in coastal regions of California and Oregon.
